sen.j: 真如三昧耶堂（しんにょさんまやどう）は、宗教法人真如苑教主・伊藤真乗の浄行を荘厳するために、真言宗醍醐派総本山醍醐寺により1997年に建立された堂。
sen.e: Shinnyosanmayado was built by Daigoji Temple, Sohonzan (the head temple of a Buddhist sect) of Daigo school of Shingon sect in 1997, to display solemnly of right behavior of Shinjo ITO, who was the founder of religious sect of a religious corporation of Shinnyoen Buddhist.

Shinnyosanmayado was built by Daigoji Temple, Sohonzan (the head temple of a Buddhist sect) of the Daigo school of the Shingon sect in 1997, in order to solemnly display the righteous behavior of Shinjo ITO, who was the founder of the sect of a religious corporation of Shinnyoen Buddhism.

Shinnyosanmayado was built by Daigo-ji Temple, Sohonzan (the head temple of a Buddhist sect) of the Daigo school of the Shingon sect in 1997, in order to solemnly display the righteous behavior of Shinjo ITO, who was the founder of the sect of a religious corporation of Shinnyoen Buddhism.

sen.j: 真如三昧耶堂のある場所は、醍醐寺開創間もない頃に建立された法華三昧堂（文明 (日本)2年（1470年）8月20日戦火により炎上）の跡地で、醍醐天皇の誓願を実現した醍醐寺の下伽藍に位置する。
sen.e: The place where Shinnyosanmayado was built, was the site of the Hokke Sanmai-do was constructed when it was not so long after Daigo-ji Temple was built, (it was burned down in the war on August 20 1470), it is located at the bottom part of the Daigo-ji Temple which Emperor Daigo's wish came true.

The place where Shinnyosanmayado was built-- the site of the Hokke Sanmai-do, which was constructed soon after Daigo-ji Temple was built (it was burned down in a battle on August 20, 1470)--is located at the bottom part of Daigo-ji Temple, marking the realization of Emperor Daigo's wish.

The place where Shinnyosanmayado was built-- the site of the Hokke Sanmai-do, which was constructed soon after Daigo-ji Temple was built (it was burned down in a battle on September 24, 1470)--is located at the bottom part of Daigo-ji Temple, marking the realization of Emperor Daigo's wish.

sen.j: これによって真如苑の法流、すなわち真如密（真言宗醍醐派の故岡田宥秀門跡が命名）が、「真如三昧耶流」という一流派として確立された。
sen.e: Due to above, one of the system of teachings of Shinnyoen Buddhist, what it was called Shinnyo mitsu (Shinnyo Esoteric) (it was named by 岡田宥秀門跡 who passed away, he was from Daigo school of Shingon sect) was establieshed as one religious school called 'Shinnyo Sanmaya School.'
